Topic.Title: Numerous failure in online grocery deliveries

Message.Msg: Nothing. They will probably lose millions of dollars but wall street will say, but the revenue grew. Why this stock keeps going up is because mutual fund managers somehow love it. the reality is that they don't make much money and probably never will. Sales growth is slowing. Groceries is a desperate attempt to grow revenue. The only ones who make money in groceries are companies like whole foods that mark up the price a lot because it's organic or fresh.

Message.Title: Be careful AMZN is set up for big drop after ER
Message.Msg: Just looked at AMZN street estimates. It keeps going down. Now the estimates is only 6 cents with 15.75 B revenue for this Q. However, its stock price has gone up from $250 to $280 level. I smell some big guys are setting up traps now. They bid it up higher to get the put at lower price. Later on they can make big money from the puts. I expect after ER, AMZN will have big drop if it just meets or even beat 10 cents. Be careful your long position.

Message.Title: CBS NEWZ: Student loan interest rates rise; Congress punts until after July 4th break
Message.Msg: Congress on Friday failed to extend the low interest rate on federal student loans, meaning that rates on Monday are doubling from 3.4 percent to 6.8 percent. Lawmakers are expected to return from their July 4th recess next week to potentially retroactively extend the lower rate for another year; in the meantime, they kept up the blame game on Monday.
